data.event: The city is named after King Ferdinand VI of Spain and placed under the patronage of Saint Ferdinand III of Castile and Le√≥n, whose feast is celebrated every 30 May.
Popularly known as the "Christmas Capital of the Philippines," the city holds the annual Giant Lantern Festival every December where large parol are displayed in competition.

event.title: holds the annual Giant Lantern Festival every December

data.event: Popularly known as the "Christmas Capital of the Philippines," the city holds the annual Giant Lantern Festival every December where large parol are displayed in competition.
The town of San Fernando was founded in 1754 from the towns of Bacolor and Mexico.
The first church was built in 1755 with wooden walls and nipa roofing.

event.title: was erected later in the year

data.event: The municipal tribunal was erected later in the year in front of the town plaza using durable materials and thatched nipa roofing.

event.title: served as its first gobernadorcillo that year

data.event: Don Vidal de Arrozal served as its first gobernadorcillo that year.
